formalText: It was not a good weekend, like really not a good weekend.
She started crying and couldn't stop crying.
She had to keep it together in church.
There wasn't any point where she felt like she needed to call  right then, but things are bad.
She started to feel like it's hard to talk about how it is in part because she doesn't want to go back to the hospital.
Also when she describes her reasoning out loud, it sounds strange.
There was a lot of well, she will not think about trying to kill herself right now.
She just wanted it to be over.
She thinks about killing herself.
She feels like she can't get out of the cycle and she's really tired of it.
The last few days she's been in this time and same place where she's just in so much pain right then that she just can't think differently, and she's a little bit out of it, but not enough out of it.
Maybe because she's worried about what she'll do.
Maybe it's because she knows that she's not going to go and try to kill herself, but she's really angry about that.
Sometimes she thinks she knows she's not going to kill herself, and sometimes she thinks that she just might. Both things feel authentic.
She doesn't want James to be scared for her or anxious about her.
But maybe he should be scared for her when there's reason for him to be. She doesn't want him not to be able to trust her.
She thinks she wishes she were dead.
She was very proud of herself and she still wanted to be dead, but she was also very proud of herself.
There's not really a good way to kill herself.
Apparently overdosing is somewhere around 2%, so she probably wouldn't do that.
She thinks she wants to jump off a building, but that seems not easy enough or easy to tell whether she'd be successful.
That would just suck balls to run out into traffic.
But that seems like a pretty horrible thing to do the person driving the car. She'd probably cut her wrists or something.
That's what she thinks about most, but that again is a pretty horrible thing to do today because he'd be the one to find her.
She just can't get out.
She doesn't have to worry about the rest of her life.
She just has to get through the day every day.
She feels useless and she's a burden to people who love her.
Things got worse over the weekend, but they didn't get drastically worse.
It seems worse everyday.
It's hard. All these things didn't used to be so hard, but she always hears herself that that's hard and then she just despises herself.
It's hard to talk about. She feels like she builds up a space or a way of being where she felt secure or felt like she did well where she felt proud of herself.
She feels like she was valuable, then that all just kind of went to where she felt like it really did backfire on her.
It's hard for her to talk about.
She's so ashamed.
She keeps trying to rephrase it to make it not quite so her fault and she just feels awful.
